12521.content:
I

Ranma Satome’s walk home from school seemed surprisingly relaxing. Akane had already headed back to the dojo, walking alongside some other girls, so he didn’t have to bicker with her. The sun was out, and not a puddle was to be seen. The curse wasn’t likely to affect him between now and the time he got home for dinner. Which would be tolerable as long as Akane wasn’t cooking.

On his was down the street, an old beggar caught his eye. “Spare some yen fine sir?”
“Sorry pops, I don’t have any spare coins,” Ranma scoffed.
“Are you sure, I’ve got some items I could trade you for it.”
Ranma looked at a towel that was opened in front of the old man. Various knickknacks, stones, and garbage were laid in front of him.
“I don’t want to trade anything for that dead rat.”
“It’s not a rat, it’s a hamster, and it keeps cats away.”
“I think it’ll keep everything away,” Ranma said as he was about to turn and leave, but suddenly, his eye caught a glimpse of some Chinese characters carved into one of the stones. “What’s that one?”

The beggar picked up the stone and examined it. “This stone was designed to get rid of curses.”
Ranma stopped and made full eye contact with the man. “What type of curses.”
“Don’t know, the characters explaining that have been carved off.”
“So it’ll cure a curse.”
“Apparently but…”
“How much?
“Well, there is…”
“How much…?”
“100 000 yen, and I’ll throw in this hamster.”
“Ew. I’m not touching that!”
“50 000 yen, but you have to take the hamster.”
“Done!” said Ranma, as he took out his money, and flung it in front of the old man, using the yen-jitsu martial art technique. The old man held out the stone, and the martial artist snapped it up.
“Young sir, you should know the stone doesn’t…” the old beggar stopped himself, and looked up to see that Ranma was already three roofs away from him. The old man looked down, and grabbed the money, only noticing now that the deceased hamster was right beside him. He sighed with disappointment. He was never going to get rid of this thing.


II


“Finally!” Ranma yelled as his feet landed on the street again. He was about to be cured from his curse. Just then he felt a cold splash hit the back of his head, and the world around him seemed bigger. Ranma turned around to spot a nearly blind woman with a ladle waving at her.

Ranma looked down at her own chest to see that her breasts were nearly popping out of her top, and saw that her pigtail was red. She didn’t even bother pretending to be shocked. This was just to common in her life.

“I wasted 50 000 yen on you!” she said to the rock as she tossed it out of view.
“Ow!” said a familiar voice in the distance.
Ranma looked over and saw that her rival Ryoga was rubbing the back of his head. On the ground, the rock was split open, and seemingly broken. Ryoga turned around to see the red-headed Ranma looking bewildered.
“You!” he said, as he picked the rock up and threw it right back at her.
The rock hit Ranma right in the forehead and she fell over backwards, surprised at Ryoga’s strength.
“Ranma, stop being a coward, change back, and give me a proper fight!” he shouted, as he walked over towards her. But as he leaned over to help her up, but him and her felt the cold water from the ladle which could never seem to hit the plants it was aiming for.

“Wait, what?” Ryoga said, feeling the cold liquid splash, but still seeing opposable thumbs before her eyes. “Am I cured?” she asked herself, before realizing that her voice was higher than usual. Actually, everything around her looked just a bit off, like she was smaller. Looking down, she saw two giant lumps trying to escape the fabric of her shirt.

“What?! NO!!!” she cried, sticking her hand between her legs only to whip it away from her body, almost instinctively. “Ramna, what did you do to me?!” she freaked out. But as she looked around, her rival wasn’t there. Instead, at her feet, she felt tiny hooves pound away at her ankles.

“Hey little piglet. Did you follow me?” she asked.
“No you idiot! I’m Ranma!” the piglet tried to scream, but all that came out were animalistic squeals.
Ryoga picked the pig up by pinching the skin together at the back of its neck. She felt it take more effort to do this than she thought. Her muscle mass had significantly decreased.

The animal thrashed about helplessly, trying to communicate its discomfort.
“That coward Ranma moved his curse to me, and left us here!” Ryoga realized, “I should find him and make him pay.”

The pig was pretty much crying at this point, as it tried to squirm to get free.
“No, don’t leave! Get the Rock with the ruins on it!” Ranma sqealed, by the girl in front of him couldn’t understand a word he said.

Ryoga picked up her pack and tossed it over her shoulder. She was still as strong as most boys her age, thanks to her obsessive training. She then opened her umbrella, and used it to shade herself from the sun. Her skin felt more sensitive than usual, and the heat was giving her discomfort, she didn’t know why.

“Come on piglet, I’ll bring you to a safe place. A dojo of my dearest Akane, she’ll care for you until we can figure out where you came from.” Ryoga tried to reassure the animal, as she held it in her free hand.

Ranma squirmed, but eventually tired himself out. He needed to go back and grab that tablet before someone else picked it up, and it was lost forever.

15431211.content:
Ranma managed to get through the doorway just as the rain fell on the doorstep. His heart was racing, that was close. He saw Akane and her family sitting around the dinner table, for a moment he thought about telling them about the changes to his curse, but then realised how embarrising it would be to tell a bunch of girls that he now turns into a pretty dress when he gets wet. Resolved not to put himself through that humiliation he thought it was best to keep it to himself. Hopefully Shampoo and her grandmother would get this fixed quickly.

He sat at the dinner table and ate a calm meal with everyone, keeping quiet about what happened today and eventually even put it out of his mind. The next day he was dragged along reluctantly with Akane, Nabiki and Kasumi to a expensive dress shop. Apparently Kuno had invited them all to a high class party and was paying for them all to get lovely new dresses to wear to it. Ranma couldn't care less. He wandered away from the group as they tried on dresses, wandering about he found himself in the wedding department, surrounded by mannequins, some dressed, others still waiting for the store dresser to dress them.

Ranma's eyes went wide as he saw all the dresses and he nervously began to move, he had a feeling that if anything would happen to him, it would happen while he was in this department. The last thing he wanted to do was blend in as some Poofy dress. Sure enough as he turned to move, the fire alarm went off in the store and the sprinkler system sprang to life.

Poor ranma had no time to react as he was soaked in freezing water and shifted into a poofy and soggy wedding dress, as he had tried to move he knocked a rack of dresses down, falling ontop of them as they all got soaked by the sprinklers. Eventually the alarm was turned off and the sprinklers stopped but the damage was done. Ranma was a soaking wet dress in a pile of equally soaking wet dresses.

He realised with horror that a wedding dress only tended to be worn once and something as fancy as he was, probably wouldn't be washed like normal clothes. It would be dry cleaned, which meant there was no water. He was beginning to regret keeping his new cursed form a secret, now no one would know where he was. Eventually the shop girls had him on a hanger as they took him and all the other dresses to the big area out back to be dry cleaned after lying in a soaking heap. Ranma tried to struggle, but of course he couldn't as a dress.

Eventually he was freshly dry cleaned, gleaming white and slipped over the hard plastic form of a mannequin. From here all he could see was dresses and other mannequins wearing dresses. He didn't know where Akane and the others were, or even how long the dry cleaning had taken. He hoped someone would buy him soon and spill something hot on him or he was screwed...

154312221.content:
From what I have seen & read dress lengths are called Long or Floor, Maxi, Midi, Knee, Mini & Micro but the styles vary and the following are (as far as I know) all the types of dresses

Ball gown, a very formal dress, typically elaborate and floor-length
 Bouffant gown, an elaborate gown with a puffed or 'bouffant' skirt.
 Bustle dress, a dress with exaggerated back fullness or detailing. (1870s onwards)
Cocktail dress, a semi-formal dress suitable for cocktail parties or similar events.
 Crinoline dress, a dress with an exaggeratedly full skirt supported by hoops or multiple petticoats. (1850s onwards)
  Débutante dress, a white dress worn by young women at debutante cotillions. Evening gown, a dress worn for evening or formal occasions. House dress, an informal dress worn for housework
 Frock, a "girlish" style of dress. Frock is also a term for a type of man's coat 
Gymslip, a sleeveless tunic most commonly worn as part of a school uniform for girls. 
Jumper dress, a sleeveless dress worn over a blouse.
Little black dress, an evening or cocktail dress, often short, a popular wardrobe staple since the 1920s.
Nightdress, worn as sleepwear, available in a variety of styles 
Princess dress, a fitted dress shaped by long shaped panels and seams rather than by darts. 
Sailor dress, a dress with sailor collar and styling. Also known as a Peter Thomson dress.
Sheath dress, a form fitting (or sheath-like) dress. 
Shift dress or chemise, a short, sleeveless dress in a simple style with little detailing 
Shirtdress, a dress borrowing details from the style of a men's shirt, often including collar or front buttons 
Slip dress, a dress closely resembling a petticoat. 
Strapless dress, a dress with no visible means of support (usually held up by interior corsetry or boning, or by elasticated fabric.) 
Trapeze dress, an exaggerated A-line dress flaring from a fitted shoulder.
Wrap dress, a dress having a front closure which wraps around the body, forming a v-shaped neckline

.
